For he said <S%H559><s%> to the snow, <S%H7950><s%> Be you on the earth; <S%H776><s%> likewise to the small rain, <S%H1653><s%> and to the great <S%H4306><s%> rain <S%H1653><s%> of his strength. <S%H5797><s%>
He seals <S%H2856><s%> up the hand <S%H3027><s%> of every <S%H3605><s%> man; <S%H120><s%> that all <S%H3605><s%> men <S%H582><s%> may know <S%H3045><s%> his work. <S%H4639><s%>
Then the beasts <S%H2416><s%> go <S%H935><s%> into <S%H1119><s%> dens, <S%H695><s%> and remain <S%H7931><s%> in their places. <S%H4585><s%>

By the breath <S%H5397><s%> of God <S%H410><s%> frost <S%H7140><s%> is given: <S%H5414><s%> and the breadth <S%H7341><s%> of the waters <S%H4325><s%> is straitened. <S%H4164><s%>
Also <S%H637><s%> by watering <S%H7377><s%> he wearies <S%H2959><s%> the thick cloud: <S%H5645><s%> he scatters <S%H6327><s%> his bright <S%H216><s%> cloud: <S%H6051><s%>

Listen <S%H238><s%> to this, <S%H2063><s%> O Job: <S%H347><s%> stand <S%H5975><s%> still, <S%H5975><s%> and consider <S%H995><s%> the wondrous <S%H6381><s%> works of God. <S%H410><s%>
Do you know <S%H3045><s%> when God <S%H433><s%> disposed <S%H7760><s%> them, and caused the light <S%H216><s%> of his cloud <S%H6051><s%> to shine? <S%H3313><s%>
Do you know <S%H3045><s%> the balancing <S%H4657><s%> of the clouds, <S%H5645><s%> the wondrous <S%H4652><s%> works of him which is perfect <S%H8549><s%> in knowledge? <S%H1843><s%>

Have you with him spread <S%H7554><s%> out the sky, <S%H7834><s%> which is strong, <S%H2389><s%> and as a molten <S%H3332><s%> looking <S%H7209><s%> glass? <S%H7209><s%>
Teach <S%H3045><s%> us what <S%H4100><s%> we shall say <S%H559><s%> to him; for we cannot <S%H3808><s%> order <S%H6186><s%> our speech by reason <S%H6440><s%> of darkness. <S%H2822><s%>
Shall it be told <S%H5608><s%> him that I speak? <S%H1696><s%> if <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> speak, <S%H559><s%> surely <S%H3588><s%> he shall be swallowed <S%H1104><s%> up.

And now <S%H6258><s%> men see <S%H7200><s%> not the bright <S%H925><s%> light <S%H216><s%> which <S%H1931><s%> is in the clouds: <S%H7834><s%> but the wind <S%H7307><s%> passes, <S%H5674><s%> and cleans <S%H2891><s%> them.
